docs.snippet: In a twist to a long-running debate over a team’s name, most Native Americans don’t seem to mind the term, according to a recent Washington Post poll....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a twist to a long-running debate over a team’s name, most Native Americans don’t seem to mind the term, according to a recent Washington Post poll.
docs.abstract: Washington Post poll finds majority of Native Americans take no offense at name of Washington Redskins football team and do not consider use of 'redskin' to be disrespectful; results add new wrinkle to ongoing debate over whether use of term constitutes slur.

headline.main: A Heated Linguistic Debate: What Makes ‘Redskins’ a Slur?
headline.print_headline: Is ‘Redskins’ Really a Slur? A Twist in a Charged Debate
